clinical_study.brief_title: Protein Consumption in Critically Ill Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Protein Consumption in Critically Ill Patients: A Retrospective Study

brief_summary.textblock: A retrospective study of protein intake and needs as well as outcomes in critically ill adult patients. Data will be collected for up to 7 days of ICU stay.

detailed_description.textblock: This retrospective study of critically ill adults receiving enteral nutrition will assess the ability to meet estimated protein and energy needs via enteral nutrition.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily protein intake (from Parenteral Nutrition, Enteral Nutrition, oral diet, and medication)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Enteral formula utilized (Standard, High protein, Very high protein)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Daily caloric intake (from Parenteral Nutrition, Enteral Nutrition, oral diet, and medication)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of daily caloric needs met (%) calorie needs met.

Daily up to 7 days of ICU stay

secondary_outcome.description: Destination of Discharge will be assessed via chart review.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, assessed an estimated 36 months

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include all patients with an ICU admission receiving enteral nutrition in a 36-month period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (age ≥18 years)
- Admitted to the ICU
- Administered at least one dose of enteral formula
Exclusion Criteria:
- Receiving exclusive oral or exclusive parenteral nutrition

facility.name: Geisinger Community Medical Center, Scranton, PA
